backend/main.mo: Defines an empty Motoko actor, serving as a placeholder backend with no exposed methods or logic.
feature_evidence.json: Structured report mapping implemented frontend features to files, components, test IDs, and confidence levels for requirements tracking.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten high-level summaries of key frontend files, describing app functionality, styling theme, Tailwind config, and entry point.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base stylesheet defining extensive OKLCH color variables for light/dark themes and core UI tokens like background, borders, and charts.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry document that sets the page title and mounts the React application at the root element.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main single-page React game implementing team setup, board rendering across seven levels, pawn movement, win detection, reset, and mini-game handling.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: React hook that creates and caches a backend actor via React Query, supporting anonymous or authenticated identities and refetching on identity change.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Authentication context and hooks for Internet Identity, managing login state, identity persistence, and AuthClient configuration.
frontend/src/index.css: Global Tailwind and custom CSS implementing a dark cosmic theme with starfield background, typography, and smooth pawn/animation utilities.
frontend/src/main.tsx: React application bootstrap that mounts App with React Query and Internet Identity providers and imports global styles.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration enabling class-based dark mode, scanning frontend source files, and extending the theme with CSS-variable-driven colors, typography, layout containers, animations, and custom fonts. It also registers typography, container queries, and animation plugins.
project_state.json: Machine-readable snapshot of the project’s current state and requirements, describing a single-page interactive “Macro → Micro” board-game-style web app for managing team progress in a live quiz. It lists schema metadata and detailed feature definitions for UI layout, team setup, pawn movement, status display, and winner logic.
